customer_reviews.title: This is my first negative review about a product, ...
customer_reviews.text: This is my first negative review about a product, and you can only imagine how upset i am. So I bought this device and barely 4 hours into use, battery is almost dead. Out of curiosity, I open the battery cover only to discover I was given a 1500mah battery, instead of 3000 as advertised. I don't know how else to communicate this as this is the first time I'm experiencing such, and so am not familiar with the process on how to go about it. I do hope my vendor can see this and get in touch with me

customer_reviews.title: NOT Huawei device
customer_reviews.text: I also received the MTN version of this device. The description specifically said this was, "Huawei E5577s-321 OEM original from Huawei without carrier logo. Original box and software." MTN's carrier logo is all over the device and the box. In the questions section, it specifically says that the Huawei and MTN devices are different, and anyone selling MTN devices should be reported to Amazon. Finally, the device is supposed to be for Europe, Middle East, and Africa, and they gave me a UK plug.

We used the device most of the day and it went down to about half battery life. We would recharge it every time we got back to the hotel room. Only once did the battery completely die, but we also had a battery pack.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up your private wifi with this Huawei E5577s-321
customer_reviews.text: This mobile Hot Spot works perfectly in Europe. I purchased a sim card in the London airport and was using it for several days, completely safely; without worries about my privacy. It is best to fully charge the device before traveling. The set up is quite easy - just insert the sim card, set your password, enter the password on your iPad or other device and begin enjoying your internet.
customer_reviews.author: Pointset

customer_reviews.title: Extremely useful and worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: Wow!!! Worked exactly as described. I used it in Germany and Iceland with an orange holiday sim card. I just popped it into the pocket wifi and it connected automatically. Battery life is good. It lasted me about 12 hours on a full charge with average usage. It's great to know that I can use this on other continents. Also, it keeps track of how much data you use so you don't go over your prepaid sim card allotment. No longer need to rent a pocket wifi. I just buy a local sim card and pop it in.
customer_reviews.author: Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Great 4G Hot Spot, confirmed usable in Shanghai and Bali.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this wi-fi hotspot specifically for my parents to use in their overseas trip. I was afraid that the interface would confuse the crap out of them, but they were able to get great use out of it! Well, pat myself in the back, because I wrote down very specific instructions on how to use it, and it helped. Anyway, they were using it in Shanghai, China as well as Bali, Indonesia, and was able to buy local SIM cards to pop in and use. My pops said the range was great and the battery life was good. No drop offs were reported. So well done, Huawei! Now if I can only find use out of it here in U.S.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Check your frequencies before you buy this. If they are supported, go ahead and buy it.

I now have an expensive battery pack.
